intro: Impatiens graciliflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
